timeline.bodyText: the args indentation should be the same.
timeline.author: moderakh

timeline.bodyText: the args indentation should be the same.
timeline.author: moderakh

timeline.bodyText:
This passes async version to the constructor of the sync version. This should be required only by implementation not public api right?
I think the constructor should be package private.
timeline.author: moderakh

timeline.bodyText: why isn't this needed anymore? in the absence of this method does the code throw the valid type of exception (if any failure)?
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: It will still throw the valid exception type. That was just wrapping the exception to CosmosException, which is what originally gets thrown by async APIs.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText: do we have tests to validate that?
replies.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText:
I reverted the change in the latest iteration to make sure we are consistent with exceptions across the SDK. Thanks for bringing this up.
Will also add tests to check the exception type.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.message: Removed unused arguments from APIs for cosmos stored procedure response
Reverted change for exception handling for stored procedure response
